Who's tired of Democrats talking about about Bush leaving out a large number of Americans? I certainly am... how do you give money to people who don't pay taxes? I'd like to figure that out.

Easily, its called the EITC, possibly the greatest piece of tax legislation in history!
 
 Besides, if we abolished the Alternative Minimum Tax (a republican pet project), then corporations would start getting money back in tax reciepts on any refundable tax credit they can weasel into.
Wow 400$, I can buy a chair with that! Its totally worth destroying our economy. Sure is, we all know chairs are more important than the jobs of millions of people!
What are you talking about? How does the tax cut destroy millions of jobs?

If it has a net negative impact on the economy (as the CBO estimates it will), then it get's rid of jobs.
 
 But even if you accept Bush's figures (1.6 million jobs created!) its still remarkably inefficient. As New York Times Columnist (and Princeton Economics Professor) Paul Krugman pointed out: if you divide the 726 billion dollar figure by the 1.6 million jobs created, you're spending approximately $453,750/job created. The national median income is around $30,000. There, the government could hire all 1.6 million people themselves at a salary 10x the national median, and STILL spend less money than it does on this tax cut. Or, you could hire them at the national median income and be able to hire 11.6 million people. Either way, the Bush Tax Cut is remarkably inefficient for its purported goals.
I thought the tax cut was only around 300 billion...? emoticon_confused

title: 4Forums.com Political Debates and Polls -  Tax Cuts
